Company Overview:

Keurig Dr Pepper (NASDAQ: KDP) is a leading beverage company in North America, with a portfolio of more than 125 owned, licensed and partners brands and powerful distribution capabilities to provide a beverage for every need, anytime, anywhere. We operate with a differentiated business model and world-class brand portfolio, powered by a talented and engaged team that is anchored in our values. We work with big, exciting beverage brands and the #1 single-serve coffee brewing system in North America at KDP, and we have fun doing it!

Together, we have built a leading beverage company in North America offering hot and cold beverages together at scale. Whatever your area of expertise, at KDP you can be a part of a team that‚Äôs proud of its brands, partnerships, innovation, and growth. Will you join us?

We strive to be an employer of choice, providing a culture and opportunities that empower our team of ~29,000 employees to grow and develop. We offer robust benefits to support your health and wellness as well as your personal and financial well-being. We also provide employee programs designed to enhance your professional growth and development, while ensuring you feel valued, inspired and appreciated at work.

Keurig Dr Pepper is an equal opportunity employer and recruits qualified applicants and advances in employment its employees without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, disability or association with a person with a disability, medical condition, genetic information, ethnic or national origin, marital status, veteran status, or any other status protected by law.

job_title: 2026 Summer Intern - Regev Lab - Molecular Design
job_description: <h3>The Position</h3><p><u><b>2026 Summer Intern - Regev Lab - Molecular Design</b></u></p><p></p><p><b><b>Department Summary</b></b></p><p></p><p><span>The Regev Lab in Genentech Research and Early Development is seeking an exceptional graduate student intern with a demonstrated research track record in developing computational models to represent and design biology at the molecular and genomic level, and the ability to independently execute on innovative ideas. </span></p><p></p><p><span>This internship position is located in</span> <b>South San Francisco, on-site. </b></p><p></p><p><b><b>The Opportunity</b></b></p><p></p><p><span>Programmable molecular design depends on learning models that can navigate exponentially large sequence spaces, which current experimental screens can only partially sample. This project asks how machine learning models can extract </span><i>generalizable structure</i><span> from novel, systematically perturbed experimental datasets and apply it to guide exploration of unseen molecular space.</span></p><p></p><p><span>In this role, you will design and train models that learn the latent ‚Äúgrammar‚Äù governing molecular function for our system of interest. Working with a large, novel experimental dataset, you will develop architectures that integrate sequence-level information with geometric and contextual representations. The focus is not merely on improving predictive accuracy, but on uncovering the inductive biases and representational strategies that enable extrapolation‚Äîwhen and why models succeed in new regimes, and when they fail.</span></p><p></p><p><span>You will explore representation learning approaches for molecular design, investigate tradeoffs between foundation-scale models and structured task-specific models, and develop insights that inform both model construction and experimental strategy. There is also an opportunity for experimental validation of model-derived hypotheses, grounding model behavior in measurable biological outcomes.</span></p><p></p><p><span>This internship is intended for students who are excited to build models that reveal structure underpinning biology ‚Äî and who are motivated by contributing work that advances the interface between machine learning and experimental biology.</span></p><p></p><p><b><b>Program Highlights</b></b></p><ul><li><p><b><b>Intensive </b><b>12-weeks</b><b> full-time (40 hours per week) paid internship.</b></b></p></li><li><p><b><b>Program start dates are in </b><b>May/June 2026.</b></b></p></li><li><p><b><b>A stipend, based on location, will be provided to help alleviate costs associated with the internship. </b></b></p></li><li><p><span>Ownership of challenging and impactful business-critical projects.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Work with some of the most talented people in the biotechnology industry.</span></p></li></ul><p></p><p><b><b>Who You Are </b></b></p><p><b><b>Required Education:</b></b></p><ul><li><p>Must be pursuing a PhD (enrolled student).</p></li></ul><p></p><p><b><b>Required Majors: </b></b>Computer Science, Biomedical Engineering/Bioengineering, Chemical Engineering, Biomedical Informatics, Computational Biology, Applied Physics, and related technical fields.</p><p></p><p><b><b>Required Skills: </b></b></p><ul><li><p><span>Strong foundation in </span>machine learning or a related quantitative field<span>, with experience training and evaluating models on real, noisy datasets.</span></p></li><li><p>Excellent programming skills<span> in Python and common deep learning frameworks (e.g. PyTorch, TensorFlow, or equivalent).</span></p></li><li><p><span>Experience working with </span>structured or high-dimensional data<span> (e.g., sequences, graphs, or other relational representations).</span></p></li><li><p><span>Experience conducting rigorous analysis and interpreting model behavior, including ability to reason about </span>model generalization and extrapolation<span> and diagnosing model limitations and failure modes. </span></p></li><li><p><span>Ability to work independently in a fast-paced research environment and clearly communicate technical results in writing and presentations; strong motivation, intellectual curiosity, and eagerness to learn through feedback and iteration.</span></p></li></ul><p></p><p><b><b>Preferred Knowledge, Skills, and Qualifications</b></b></p><ul><li><p><span>Excellent communication, collaboration, and interpersonal skills.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Complements our culture and the standards that guide our daily behavior & decisions: Integrity, Courage, and Passion.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Experience with </span>representation learning<span>, including learning latent or compositional features from structured data.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Experience with </span>sequence- and/or structure-based modeling<span> (e.g., CNNs, transformers, protein language models).</span></p></li><li><p><span>Familiarity with </span>combinatorial or design-oriented modeling problems<span>, where generalization beyond observed data is critical.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Interest in or experience with </span>molecular or biological data<span>, such as protein sequences or molecular structures.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Prior research experience in machine learning, computational biology, or a related quantitative field.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Track record publishing in ML/Comp Bio conferences (ICLR/ICML/NeurIPS/MLCB, etc).</span></p></li><li><p><span>Interest in connecting modeling insights to </span>experimentally testable hypotheses<span>.</span></p><p></p></li></ul><p><b><b>Relocation benefits are not available for this job posting. </b></b></p><p></p><p><span>The expected salary range for this position based on the primary location of California<span> </span>is </span><span>$50.00 hourly. Actual pay will be determined based on experience, qualifications, geographic location, and other job-related factors permitted by law. This position also qualifies for paid holiday time off benefits.</span></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><span>Genentech is an equal opportunity employer. It is our policy and practice to employ, promote, and otherwise treat any and all employees and applicants on the basis of merit, qualifications, and competence. The company's policy prohibits unlawful discrimination, including but not limited to, discrimination on the basis of Protected Veteran status, individuals with disabilities status, and consistent with all federal, state, or local laws.</span></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><span>If you have a disability and need an accommodation in relation to the online application process, please contact us by completing this form <a target="_blank" href="https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdZWlsbfQOvFVIQgHE_iDzWUTlhZvj6FytIzjS7xq6IGh1H5g/viewform">Accommodations for Applicants</a>.</span></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p>

job_title: Greater Chicago Fulfillment Center - Digital Team Internship
job_description: <p style="text-align:left"><b>Job Location</b></p>CINCINNATI GENERAL OFFICES<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><b>Job Description</b></p><p>P&G is the largest consumer packaged goods company in the world. We have operations in over 75 countries, with 65 trusted brands that improve lives for 5 billion consumers worldwide. This brings many advantages, including the opportunity for our employees to enjoy a diverse and rewarding lifelong career filled with new and exciting challenges. We give you the tools to become a world class leader!</p><p></p><p>P&G is recognized as one of the Top Companies for Executive Women, Fast Company Best Workplace for Innovators, and as one of the Most Reputable Companies by both Forbes and Fortune.</p><p></p><p>How would you like to spend your summer on a dynamic team supporting warehouse automation, build digital tools, and work on continuous improvement projects? A Supply Chain Internship will give you the opportunity to tremendous impacts on our supply chain end-to-end.</p><p></p><p>We want engineers and data experts who can handle dynamic work environments and who know how to think outside the box! We rely on our Supply Chain Interns to add fresh perspective to our supply chain that will impact our business for years to come!</p><p></p><p>Your summer is bound to be lively, and you will have opportunities to interact with senior leadership, network with fellow interns and new hires, and grow relationships in and outside of work! Depending on your final placement, you will have the opportunity to work on projects in our Warehouses, customer teams and end to end supply chain systems.<span> </span><b>SNO Internships start in late May and end in early August, lasting 12 weeks.</b></p><p></p><p>There are a variety of responsibilities you could have as SNO Summer Intern, here are a few examples:</p><ul><li><p>o Identifying, prioritizing, analyzing, and eliminating losses and inefficiencies</p><p>o Implement dashboards to improve Mixing Center efficiency and improve productivity</p><p>o Build visualizations for site flow, capacity planning and other business solutions.</p><p>o Track active initiatives and their health status.</p><p>o Support P&G‚Äôs Corporate Citizenship priorities, such as Equality & Inclusion, Sustainability, and community impact.</p></li></ul><p></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left"><b>Job Qualifications</b></p><div><b>What We are Looking for:</b></div><div><div><div><div><p></p><p>Working towards a Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs in Supply Chain <span>Management/Logistics,</span> Industrial Engineering, Other Business Administration or Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics.</p><ul><li><b>Excellent visionary, strategic and courageous leadership skills</b></li><li>Problem solving via innovation & creativity</li><li>Strong <span>thinking/problem-solving</span> skills which can be applied to business processes with a "can-do" attitude</li><li>Ability to collaborate effectively within a multicultural environment</li></ul><p></p><p><b>Just So You Know:</b></p><p></p><p>We are committed to providing equal opportunities in employment. We value diversity and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.</p><p></p><h2>Starting Pay / Salary Range: $29-50/hr</h2><p></p><p>Compensation for roles at P&G varies depending on a wide array of non-discriminatory factors including but not limited to the specific office location, role, degree/credentials, relevant skill set, and level of relevant experience. At P&G compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. job_title: Work Based Learning - Summer Intern Student
job_description: <strong>Job Requirements </strong><br><p><span style="color: black;">Position Summary</span></p><p> </p><p>High school students on the path to a medical career may apply to enter Spartanburg Regional Health Care System‚Äôs Work-Based Learning Summer Internship. These students will work alongside professionals in the healthcare environment to learn foundational skills that can transfer to various healthcare fields. Work-based Learning (WBL) combines classroom-based education with on-the-job training experiences to help students prepare for or explore their work-site objectives. Students selected into this program will have the opportunity to practice critical thinking, problem solving, and communication skills while working alongside highly skilled medical professionals. This experience must be planned and supervised by the school and employer so that it contributes to the student‚Äôs education and employability. Orientation into this role will be required.</p><p> </p><p><span style="color: black;">Minimum Requirements </span></p><p> </p><p><strong>Education</strong></p><ul><li>Current Junior or Senior enrolled in a Spartanburg, Cherokee, or Union County High School at time of application</li></ul><p><strong>Experience</strong></p><ul><li>N/A</li></ul><p><strong>License/Registration/Certifications</strong></p><ul><li>N/A</li></ul><p> </p><p><span style="color: black;">Preferred Requirements</span></p><p> </p><p><strong>Preferred Education</strong>      </p><ul><li>N/A</li></ul><p><strong>Preferred Experience</strong>     </p><ul><li>N/A</li></ul><p><strong>Preferred License/Registration/Certifications     </strong></p><ul><li>American Heart BLS Provider Course</li></ul><p><span style="color: black;">Core Job Responsibilities</span></p><p> </p><ul><li>Follows assigned department‚Äôs guidelines, roles, and responsibilities</li><li>Identifies areas for improvement and seeks ways to work on self-defined weaknesses</li><li>Remains committed to unit, department, and organization goals</li><li>Adheres to proper chain of command</li><li>Demonstrate exceptional customer service and professionalism in all interactions  </li><li>Assist staff to maintain cleanliness of environment </li><li>Stock and/or organize supplies and equipment  </li><li>Run errands, answer unit telephone, answer and respond to call lights </li><li>Follows Infection Control Procedures </li><li>Other duties as assigned by the department</li></ul><br><br>

<h1><b><b><b>Job Description Summary</b></b></b></h1>Join GE HealthCare as the HR Talent Program Intern and play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our recruitment and hiring processes. <br><br>In this role, you‚Äôll help build talent pipelines and support our national Service Apprentice Program. You‚Äôll work closely with leaders on tasks like reviewing resumes, scheduling interviews, and keeping data organized. You‚Äôll also assist with sending exit surveys and updating trackers to monitor current apprentices and those exiting the program.<br><br>Beyond day-to-day tasks, you‚Äôll have the chance to work on projects such as creating an external partnership tracker or developing training sessions for apprentices to support their ongoing skill development.<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><h1><b>Job Description</b></h1><p><b>Responsibilities</b></p><ul><li><p>Assist with recruiting and hiring activities, including posting jobs in Workday, reviewing resumes, scheduling interviews, and monitoring pre-employment steps.</p></li><li><p>Keep internal trackers up to date to ensure accurate data for workforce planning and program management.</p></li><li><p>Support coordination of training sessions, monthly calls, and other program events.</p></li><li><p>Assist with sending exit surveys and collecting feedback to improve programs.</p></li><li><p>Help maintain external partnership information and support outreach to schools for local talent pipelines.</p></li><li><p>Collaborate with leaders on program initiatives.</p></li><li><p>Contribute to projects such as creating a partnership tracker or developing training sessions for apprentices.</p></li></ul><p></p><p><b>Required Qualifications</b></p><div><ul><li><p>Currently enrolled in an Associate or Bachelor‚Äôs degree program.</p></li><li><p>Strong written and verbal communication skills.</p></li><li><p>Good organizational skills and ability to manage multiple tasks.</p></li><li><p>Proficiency in Microsoft Word and PowerPoint; basic Excel skills for charts and data tables.</p></li><li><p>Comfortable using internet tools and web applications for research and communication.</p></li><li><p><span>Legal authorization to work in the U.S. is required. We will not sponsor individuals for employment visas, now or in the future, for this job.</span></p></li></ul></div><div><p></p><p><b>Desired Characteristics</b></p><ul><li><p>Previous experience in Human Resources: recruitment, learning & development, or program management.</p></li><li><p>Detail-oriented with a process-focused mindset.</p></li><li><p>Familiarity with Workday or other HR systems.</p></li><li><p>Familiarity with Smartsheet.</p></li></ul><p></p><p>For U.S. based positions only, the pay range for this position is $15 - $20 an hour. It is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the pay range and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. The specific compensation offered to a candidate may be influenced by a variety of factors including skills, qualifications, experience and location. In addition, this position may also be eligible to earn performance-based incentive compensation, which may include cash bonus(es) and/or long term incentives (LTI). GE HealthCare offers a competitive benefits package, including not but limited to medical, dental, vision, paid time off, a 401(k) plan with employee and company contribution opportunities, life, disability, and accident insurance, and tuition reimbursement.‚Äã</p><p></p><p>We expect all employees to live and breathe our behaviors: to act with humility and build trust; lead with transparency; deliver with focus, and drive ownership ‚Äì always with unyielding integrity.</p><p></p><p>Our total rewards are designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you‚Äôd expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you‚Äôll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.</p></div><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p>We will not sponsor individuals for employment visas, now or in the future, for this job opening.

<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><h1><b><b><b>Additional Information</b></b></b></h1><div><div><div><div><div><div><div><p style="text-align:left"><span>GE HealthCare offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging careers, and competitive compensation. GE HealthCare is an </span><a href="https://www.eeoc.gov/sites/default/files/2022-10/22-088_EEOC_KnowYourRights_10_20.pdf" target="_blank">Equal Opportunity Employer</a><span><a href="http://www.ge.com/sites/default/files/15-000845%20EEO%20combined.pdf" target="_blank">.</a> Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.</span></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><div><div><div><div><div><div><div><p style="text-align:left"><span>GE HealthCare will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States for this opening. Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a drug screen (as applicable). </span></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left">While GE HealthCare does not currently require U.S. employees to be vaccinated against COVID-19, some GE HealthCare customers have vaccination mandates that may apply to certain GE HealthCare employees.</p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><div><div><div><div><div><div><div><p style="text-align:left"><b>Relocation Assistance Provided: </b><span>No</span></p></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p>

<p style="text-align: center;"><strong>Accounting Co-op/Intern - Summer 2026</strong></p><p> </p><p>This job description reflects potential openings for the <strong>Summer 2026</strong> <strong>Co-op/Internship</strong> Session (May-August). This is a general job description and represents multiple openings in various departments. <strong>Honda offers both single and multi-semester co-ops and internships. College students must apply to the requisition pertaining to their major and semester of </strong><strong>interest.</strong></p><p><strong>Please note:</strong><strong> </strong>Sponsorship for employment visa status for these positions is unavailable. Applicants requiring sponsorship for employment visa status now or in the future (e.g., F-1 CPT/OPT, H-1B, TN, etc.) will not be considered.</p><p> </p><p style="text-align: center;"><strong>More about the Accounting/Finance Co-op/ Intern at Honda</strong></p><p> </p><p>The below descriptions reflect <em>potential</em> environments and duties within our various Accounting/ Finance Co-op/ Intern positions that we offer. Work environments and projects may include but are not limited to:</p><p><span style="-webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-size-adjust: none; text-decoration: underline;">North American Strategy and Planning</span><span style="-webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-size-adjust: none;">:</span></p><ul><li>Co-op's will have the opportunity to work within a general ledger group and perform analysis on balance sheet accounts, improve reconciliation techniques and see the compilation of the financial statements. Position Summary

Samsung Electronics America, Inc. is now accepting applications for its Summer 2026 Intern Program. This exciting opportunity offers a paid, 10-week experience for selected UNDERGRAD OR GRAD (based on HM request) students. The program will run from June 1 to August 7.

Eligible students will be seniors or recent graduates, possess U.S. work authorization, and be able to work full-time on a 5-day-per-week on-site schedule. Additionally, participation in this program requires that you be located in the United States for the duration of the engagement.

Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis, so early submission is encouraged. The application window is open until March 15, 2026; however, it may close earlier if all available roles are filled. Applications submitted after the application window or once a role is closed/projects are full will not be considered.

Headquartered in Englewood Cliffs, N.J., Samsung Electronics America, Inc. (SEA), the U.S. Sales and Marketing subsidiary, is a leader in mobile technologies, consumer electronics, home appliances, enterprise solutions and networks systems. For more than four decades, Samsung has driven innovation, economic growth and workforce opportunity across the United States-investing over $100 billion and employing more than 20,000 people nationwide. By integrating our large portfolio of products, services and AI technology, we're creating smarter, sustainable and more connected experiences that empower people to live better. SEA is a wholly owned subsidiary of Samsung Electronics Co., Ltd. To learn more, visit Samsung.com. For the latest news, visit news.samsung.com/us.

Role and Responsibilities

Position Summary

This internship focuses on optimizing profitability through the development and implementation of effective promotional strategies for Samsung's TV, Monitor, and Soundbar products. The intern will work closely with cross-functional teams to analyze historical promotional campaigns, design innovative strategies, and monitor their impact on revenue and profitability. This role offers a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience in business management, market research, and financial modeling while contributing to the success of Samsung's product categories.

Key Responsibilities

Promotion Analysis:
‚Ä¢ Evaluate historical promotional campaigns to identify what has worked best in terms of revenue growth and profitability.
‚Ä¢ Assess the impact of promotions on attach rates and customer engagement.

Strategy Development:
‚Ä¢ Design and refine promotional strategies tailored to TV, Monitor, and Soundbar products.
‚Ä¢ Propose innovative promotional models, such as bundling or subscription-based offers, to increase attach rates.

Financial Modeling:
‚Ä¢ Build financial models to assess the potential impact of proposed promotional strategies on revenue and profitability.
‚Ä¢ Evaluate the scalability of these strategies across different markets.

Implementation & Monitoring:
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with cross-functional teams to execute the developed promotional strategies.
‚Ä¢ Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to track success and make data-driven adjustments as needed.

General Responsibilities

Market Research and Analysis:
‚Ä¢ Conduct in-depth market research to identify emerging trends, customer preferences, and competitive dynamics.
‚Ä¢ Analyze existing revenue streams and promotional strategies to pinpoint opportunities for enhancement.

Reporting and Recommendations:
‚Ä¢ Prepare detailed reports on the progress and outcomes of the implemented strategies.
‚Ä¢ Offer actionable recommendations for continuous improvement and long-term sustainability.

Qualifications

Education:
‚Ä¢ Currently pursuing a Master's Degree.
‚Ä¢ Preferred academic fields of study: Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics
‚Ä¢ Final-year graduate students are strongly preferred.

Technical Skills:
‚Ä¢ Strong analytical skills with proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., Excel, Tableau).
‚Ä¢ Experience in market research and strategic planning.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of financial modeling and business metrics.
‚Ä¢ Excellent communication and presentation skills to effectively convey ideas and findings.

Skills:
‚Ä¢ Experience in e-commerce, digital business development, or site management is a plus.
‚Ä¢ Technical understanding of e-commerce platforms and integrations.
‚Ä¢ Ability to define and report functional requirements for digital features.
‚Ä¢ Adaptable and collaborative in a dynamic digital environment.

This internship is based in Englewood Cliffs, New Jersey, and offers a unique opportunity to contribute to Samsung's product categories while gaining valuable experience in category business management, market research, and strategic planning. The intern will have the chance to work on impactful projects, collaborate with experienced professionals, and develop skills that are highly relevant in the field of business management.

Skills and Qualifications

The hourly rate for this role is $49. Actual pay will be determined considering factors such as relevant skills and experience, and comparison to other employees in the role.

Are you looking for an exciting job where you can put your skills and talents to work at a company you can feel proud to be a part of? Do you want a workplace that will challenge you and offer you opportunities to learn and grow? A position at Xcel Energy could be just what you‚Äôre looking for.

At Xcel Energy, our employees are the driving force behind our success. So we make sure that, here, you can be your best. Doing work that makes a difference for neighbors and communities. Working with a team you can count on to push you. Expanding skills, staying ready for change, and capturing opportunities to grow. All with the support, rewards and recognition you need to thrive ‚Äì during your internship and beyond.

Project Description

Artificial Intelligence is transforming how work gets done‚Äîand Xcel Energy is focused on making sure that transformation delivers real, measurable business value.

We‚Äôre looking for an AI Enablement Intern to join a high‚Äëimpact team working at the intersection of AI technology, business problem‚Äësolving, and organizational change. This is a cutting‚Äëedge role for someone excited by AI who wants to help shape how it is applied across a large enterprise‚Äînot as experimentation, but as a practical driver of productivity and better ways of working.

In this role, you‚Äôll operate much like a business‚Äëfacing AI solution architect. You‚Äôll partner with teams across the company to understand how their work actually gets done, identify broken or inefficient processes, and help determine where AI‚Äîsuch as Microsoft Copilot or AI agents‚Äîcan meaningfully improve outcomes. From there, you‚Äôll help turn those ideas into reality by supporting the thoughtful implementation, adoption, and scaling of AI‚Äëenabled solutions.

At the same time, you‚Äôll contribute to the middle‚Äëout engine that makes AI adoption stick: building community, learning from real wins, and spreading what works so teams can learn from one another. Technology alone doesn‚Äôt transform organizations‚Äîthe combination of the right solutions and the right enablement does. That‚Äôs the work this team leads.

This position is for a June 1, 2026 start. The role may have the possibility to extend beyond the internship based on performance and business needs.

What You‚Äôll Work On

This role intentionally blends two dimensions of our AI Enablement strategy:

Top‚ÄëDown: AI Solutioning & Business Value

  • Partner with business teams in a consultative manner to understand workflows, pain points, and opportunities for improvement.
  • Help identify where AI is appropriate‚Äîand where it isn‚Äôt‚Äîby mapping real business problems to practical AI solutions.
  • Contribute to the design of AI‚Äëenabled solutions that improve broken or inefficient processes, with a strong focus on value over novelty.
  • Support implementation efforts, recognizing that successful AI adoption requires more than technology‚Äîit requires clear communication, change management, and smart rollout approaches.
  • Help assess and communicate impact, including how AI solutions are improving productivity, quality, or the employee experience.

Middle‚ÄëOut: Community, Learning & Scale

  • Contribute to building the AI community at Xcel Energy by supporting initiatives like the Copilot Flight Plan, Copilot Champions, and Hero Stories that highlight real success.
  • Help capture and share wins, lessons learned, and best practices so effective AI usage spreads across teams.
  • Support engagement strategies that inspire curiosity, confidence, and responsible use of AI tools.
  • Enable teams to learn from one another by helping package insights, stories, and examples in ways that are easy to reuse and adapt.

You‚Äôll work as part of the AI Enablement team, collaborating internally while also engaging directly with business partners across the organization.

Minimum Requirements

  • Currently enrolled in a bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs program (as of Fall 2026) in a relevant field (e.g., Business, Information Systems, Engineering, Analytics, Communications, Organizational Development, or similar).
  • Strong curiosity about AI and how it can reshape work‚Äînot just from a technology perspective, but from a business and human perspective.
  • Ability to engage with stakeholders, ask good questions, and translate ambiguous problems into clear next steps.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills; comfortable explaining ideas to both technical and non‚Äëtechnical audiences.
  • Comfort operating in ambiguity and learning quickly in a fast‚Äëevolving space.
  • Must be a local resident in CO or MN.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience working on cross‚Äëfunctional projects involving technology, process improvement, consulting, or product strategy.
  • Familiarity with modern AI tools (e.g., Microsoft Copilot, automation tools, analytics platforms), or strong interest in learning them quickly.
  • Experience with storytelling, presentations, or content creation that helps spread ideas and best practices.
  • Exposure to change management, adoption strategies, or community‚Äëbuilding efforts.
  • Basic data literacy‚Äîcomfortable interpreting simple trends or signals to support decision‚Äëmaking.

Visa sponsorship is not offered for this position.

Our Wellness Centers are full gyms equipped with cardio machines, weights, basketball courts, pools, dieticians, personal trainers and group fitness classes.</p><p><strong>Paid overtime: </strong>Co-ops and Interns will receive 1.5 times their hourly rate of pay for any overtime worked.</p><p><strong>Consideration for full time employment: </strong>Our Cooperative Learning Internships program is utilized as a talent pipeline for our full time positions!</p><p><strong>Hourly Wage Range: </strong>$27.22-$35.22</p><p><em><strong>Pay will be based on several variables that include, but not limited to, geographic location, work experience, education, etc.</strong></em></p><p><em>Additional details regarding Honda Co-op and Intern benefits are provided upon offer.</em></p>

<p style="text-align:left">You‚Äôve invested a lot of time and energy in your education. Now you want the chance to make your mark. We offer challenging opportunities for you to learn and grow professionally. In our programs, you‚Äôll be immersed in a culture of continuous improvement, with the goal of changing health care for the better.</p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p><b>Position Summary:</b></p><p>Health is everything. At CVS Health, colleagues are committed to increasing access, lowering costs, and improving quality of care. Millions of times a day, we help people on their path to better health ‚Äìfrom advising on prescriptions to helping manage chronic and specialty conditions. As a 3rd year pharmacy intern, you have a significant role in our company working as a part of the pharmacy team‚Äì delivering our purpose, modeling our values, and demonstrating genuine, authentic care for our patients. </p><p></p><p>While working as a 3rd year pharmacy intern, under the direct supervision of a licensed pharmacist, you play a critical role in ensuring a safe and effective Retail Pharmacy work environment that delivers exceptional care to each patient. This includes but is not limited to:</p><ul><li>Patient Safety</li><li>Pharmacy Professional Practice</li><li>Regulatory Requirements</li><li>Quality Assurance</li><li>Customer Service</li><li>Inventory Management</li><li>Workflow Management excluding final prescription verification</li></ul><p></p><p><b>Primary Roles and Responsibility: </b></p><p>A key component of the pharmacy intern role is keeping your customers and patients healthy through adoption and management of patient care programs. Additionally, you will:</p><ul><li>Lead with Heart ‚Äì display empathy and compassion for your patients, customers, caregivers, and colleagues on your team</li><li>Seek new ways to grow, collaborate with others, and deliver better outcomes</li><li>Align others around our purpose to bring your heart to every moment of your health and gain support and commitment</li><li>Facilitate a team culture that promotes caring, energy, enthusiasm, and pride</li></ul><p></p><p><b><u>Education:</u></b></p><ul><li>Accepted into or actively enrolled in an ACPE accredited college or school of pharmacy</li></ul><p></p><p><b><u>Required Qualifications:</u></b></p><ul><li>Accepted into or actively enrolled in an ACPE accredited college or school of pharmacy</li><li>0-3 years relevant work experience</li><li>Must possess or be in process of obtaining valid intern and/or technician licensure as required</li><li>Strong communication and presentation skills</li><li>Complete all required training within state guidelines and required timeframe</li><li>Ability to:<ul><li>Have regular and predictable attendance, including nights and weekends</li><li>Be mobile and remain upright for extended periods of time</li><li>Lift, scan, and bag items</li><li>Finger Dexterity: Picking, pinching, typing or otherwise working primarily with fingers rather than whole hand or arm</li><li>Reach overhead; able to stretch or reach out with the body, arms, and/or legs to grasp items</li><li>Extend hand(s) and arm(s) multiple directions to place, move, or lift items</li><li>Precision control: able to adjust machines to exact positions</li><li>Stoop to a considerable degree and requiring full use of the lower extremities and back muscles to move items between low and high positions, including bending spine at the waist</li><li>Visual Acuity: Close visual acuity to perform activities such as: transcribing, viewing a computer terminal, reading, visual inspection involving small parts</li><li>Able to orally communicate information and instructions to colleagues and customers</li><li>Occasional lifting of up to 20 lbs; exerting up to 20 lbs. of force occasionally and/or up to 10 lbs. of force frequently, and/or a negligible amount of force constantly to move objects</li></ul></li></ul><p></p><p><b><u>Ability To: </u></b></p><ul><li>Have regular and predictable attendance, including nights and weekends</li><li>Complete any additional tasks as directed by supervisor or manager</li><li>Complete all required training and obtain required licensure (if applicable) within state guidelines</li></ul><p></p><p><b><u>Preferred Qualifications:</u></b></p><ul><li>Immunization eligibility</li><li>Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc.)</li><li>Once state regulations are met, pharmacy interns should be striving to provide patient immunizations as this is an essential pharmacist function</li></ul><p style="text-align:left"><b>Pay Range</b></p><p style="text-align:left">The typical pay range for this role is:</p><p style="text-align:inherit"><br /> </p>$18.50 - $20.25<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"><br /> </p><p style="text-align:left">Whether in our pharmacies or through our health service offerings, we are pioneering a bold new approach to total health care. As health care innovators, we are making quality care affordable, accessible, simple and seamless. We await your fresh ideas, new perspectives, and the unique contributions you will make to our organization.</p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p>We anticipate the application window for this opening will close on: 03/01/2026<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left">Qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with all federal, state and local laws.</p>

job_title: Studio Operations in Home Mastering Intern, Summer 2026
job_description:
About the Role & Program

Studio Operations in Home Mastering provides an extensive range of digital file-based solutions to support filmmaking, mastering, asset finishing, distribution, sound mixing, editorial suites, and theatre and screening facilities.

We are seeking a dedicated intern to join our Studio Operations in Home Mastering team for the summer term. The selected candidate will actively contribute to strategic projects encompassing all stages of the digital supply chain.

This internship is full-time and will be based in Burbank, CA, running from May 2026 through August 2026.

What You Will Do

Support the internal mastering workflow from order creation, fulfillment, and QC in the following ways:

  • Identify key operational metrics and develop corresponding models and dashboards.

  • Refine the process of collecting and managing scorecard metrics.

  • Continuously improve production tools and methodologies.

  • Gather and analyses user requirements for software enhancements.

  • Document and map existing workflows.

  • Administrative responsibilities include supporting work order creation, providing daily ad hoc assistance, and collecting requirements, assets, and deliverables.

Required Qualifications & Skills

  • Experienced with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook).

  • Background in working with AI, video, and audio technologies.

  • Able to think strategically about end-to-end workflows, proposing and implementing improvements for operational efficiency.

  • Excels in fast-paced settings, maintains organization under pressure, and effectively manages multiple projects by prioritizing and adapting as required.

  • Holds prior experience in the entertainment industry.

Education

  • Junior or Senior year preferred

  • Major or previous coursework in Media, Cinema or Business-related

Eligibility Requirements & Program Information:

Candidates for this opportunity MUST meet all of the below requirements:

  • Be enrolled in an accredited college/university pursuing a degree taking at least one class at time of application OR currently participating in a Disney College Program or Disney Internship.

  • Current Disney Interns, College, International, or Culinary Program Participants: You may only work for ONE consecutive year (12 months) in any combination of an internship and/or program.

  • Be at least 18 years of age

  • Possess unrestricted work authorization

Additional Information:

  • Must provide full work availability from June through August 2026.

  • Must provide own housing and transportation, position is located in Burbank, CA.


The pay rate for this role in California is $22.50 per hour. Select benefits may be provided as part of the compensation package, such as medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the level and position offered. To learn more about our benefits visit: https://jobs.disneycareers.com/benefits.

Job Description

About the Role

Uber's Strategic Finance team is uniquely positioned to have transparency into Uber's overall global business and to use financial & operational data to reach insights others might not be able to make. The team is responsible for working closely with cross-functional teams to support financial planning, tracking key financial metrics, driving efficiency, and making product and business recommendations.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to support one of our high growth businesses and use insights to help Uber prioritize initiatives and reach conclusions. As part of the summer program, your deliverable will be a business recommendation to the Strategic Finance Leadership team.

Pro Tip: Apply early-roles may close sooner than expected due to high demand.

What You'll Do
‚Ä¢ Financial Planning: be part of the team that is responsible for financial planning, forecasting, reporting, and analysis for Uber's global business
‚Ä¢ Strategic Thinking: Apply business judgment and financial insights to assist with decision making related to new initiatives, products, and business opportunities
‚Ä¢ Financial Modeling: Build intricate financial models from scratch, improve existing models, and break complex models down into component parts
‚Ä¢ Operational Excellence: Lead initiatives that help us scale from startup to enterprise
Basic Qualifications
‚Ä¢ Currently enrolled in a BS/BA program in Finance, Accounting, Economics or a similar field (graduation date Winter 2028 - Spring 2029)
‚Ä¢ Basic knowledge of GAAP and experience with Excel/gSheets
‚Ä¢ Minimum 1 year of involvement in extracurricular groups, activities, or internship opportunities
Preferred Qualifications
‚Ä¢ Prior analytical internship experience in the technology industry, including FP&A, investment banking, management consulting or private equity
‚Ä¢ Leadership positions in any extracurricular activities
‚Ä¢ Proven understanding of GAAP, enterprise-level financial planning systems, SQL, and/or statistical software packages
‚Ä¢ Outstanding analytical skills
‚Ä¢ Excellent interpersonal skills
‚Ä¢ Ability to structure effective presentations
‚Ä¢ Attention to detail and ability to execute in a fast paced environment
‚Ä¢ Self-starter - you take initiative, set goals, and meet them
About the Team

We are a global and expansive team that excels at combining strategy and real numbers. We are leaders helping to set the financial and strategic direction of the company.

We are embedded in all the global businesses and functions of Uber, setting the financial plans and operating cadence. However, our work really begins when the plans are set. We proactively connect the dots, set the course, and help the company deliver on its goals!

We also don't just say how it is. We are members of the team that finds and implements the solutions to our biggest challenges.

For New York, NY-based roles: The base hourly rate amount for this role is USD$31.00 per hour.

You will also be eligible for various benefits.

Job Description:

Job Summary

Johnson & Johnson Innovative Medicine is seeking a Neuroscience Digital Health & Data Science Intern to support the Neuroscience Data Science and Digital Health organization within the Digital and AI Measures team. This internship provides hands‚Äëon experience working with digital health technologies, neuroscience data, and analytics used in clinical and translational research.

The intern will support the evaluation, integration, and analysis of multimodal data sources‚Äîincluding speech‚Äëbased digital measures, imaging‚Äëderived features, and clinical datasets‚Äîwhile collaborating with cross‚Äëfunctional data science, clinical, and biomarker teams.

Key Responsibilities

  • Support cleaning, validation, and exploratory analysis of digital health and neuroscience datasets

  • Assist with data cleaning and evaluation of speech‚Äëbased and imaging‚Äëderived digital measures used in clinical research

  • Contribute to development of analysis workflows and documentation under guidance of senior data scientists

  • Perform data quality checks and summarize findings through figures, tables, and presentations

  • Support literature review and benchmarking of digital health and AI‚Äëenabled measurement approaches

  • Assist with documentation related to data handling and analytical processes and drafting the manuscript

Required Qualifications

  • Currently enrolled in Undergraduate or Graduate program in Bioengineering, Neuroscience, Computational Biology and Data Science, Biomedical Engineering and Bioinformatics

  • Completion of at least two years of undergraduate study by internship start

  • Strong analytical and problem‚Äësolving skills

  • Experience programming in Python for data analysis

  • Ability to clearly communicate technical concepts to both technical and non‚Äëtechnical audiences

Preferred Qualifications

  • Prior experience with biomedical, clinical, or digital health datasets

  • Familiarity with machine learning concepts and basic statistical methods

  • Experience with additional tools such as R, Power BI, or data visualization libraries

  • Research or industry experience in neuroscience, bioengineering, or health technology

  • Strong organizational skills and ability to work in a collaborative, fast‚Äëpaced environment

Internship Details

  • Location: Remote

  • Travel: No travel expected

  • Hours: Full‚Äëtime (40 hours/week)

Equal Opportunity Statement

Permanently authorized to work in the U.S., must not require sponsorship of an employment visa (e.g., H-1B or green card) at the time of application or in the future. Students currently on CPT, OPT, or STEM OPT usually requires future sponsorship for long term employment and do not meet the requirements for this program unless eligible for an alternative long-term status that does not require company sponsorship.

Johnson & Johnson is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by federal, state or local law. We actively seek qualified candidates who are protected veterans and individuals with disabilities as defined under VEVRAA and Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act.

Johnson & Johnson is committed to providing an interview process that is inclusive of our applicants‚Äô needs. If you are an individual with a disability and would like to request an accommodation, external applicants please contact us via https://www.jnj.com/contact-us/careers . Internal employees contact AskGS to be directed to your accommodation resource.

For quota-based incentive pay, Cisco typically pays as follows:</p><ul><li><p>.75% of incentive target for each 1% of revenue attainment up to 50% of quota;</p></li><li><p>1.5% of incentive target for each 1% of attainment between 50% and 75%;</p></li><li><p>1% of incentive target for each 1% of attainment between 75% and 100%; and</p></li><li><p>Once performance exceeds 100% attainment, incentive rates are at or above 1% for each 1% of attainment with no cap on incentive compensation.</p></li></ul><p></p><p>For non-quota-based sales performance elements such as strategic sales objectives, Cisco may pay 0% up to 125% of target. Cisco sales plans do not have a minimum threshold of performance for sales incentive compensation to be paid.</p><p></p><p>The applicable full salary ranges for this position, by specific state, are listed below:</p><p></p><p>New York City Metro Area:</p>$44,000.00 - $185,000.00<p>Non-Metro New York state & Washington state: </p>$44,000.00 - $185,000.00<p>* For quota-based sales roles on Cisco‚Äôs sales plan, the ranges provided in this posting include base pay and sales target incentive compensation combined.</p><p>** Employees in Illinois, whether exempt or non-exempt, will participate in a unique time off program to meet local requirements.</p>

<p><b>WEX Inc.</b><span><b> </b>is a global commerce platform that has been simplifying the way businesses operate for over 40 years. You will play a key role in our tire program‚Äôs authorization process by taking regular inbound phone calls and assisting commercial tire dealers with sales processes. <br /><br /><b>How you'll make an impact:</b></span></p><ul><li><p><span>A collaborative and challenging working environment.</span></p></li><li><p><span>The opportunity to engage with various stakeholders across the business including human resources, and senior leadership teams.</span></p></li><li><p><span>To train and develop your skills in your area of work with some of the best experts in the Payments and Transportation industries.</span></p></li><li><p><span>The opportunity to hone your sales skills in various mediums of communication. These are skills that will accelerate any sales career.</span></p></li></ul><p></p><p><span><span style="font-size:14px"><b>Experience you'll bring:</b></span></span></p><ul><li><p><span>Preferred Location: Salt Lake City, Utah; or Nashville, TN for a hybrid work schedule.</span></p></li><li><p><span>At a minimum, you should be a rising Junior, or Senior in a degree/certificate-seeking accredited Bachelor's program.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Strong time management skills, including planning and execution.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Strong written and verbal communication skills, including presenting information.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Strong quantitative, analytical, and problem-solving skills.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Strong interpersonal and communication skills.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Ability to work in a dynamic, collaborative environment, and a willingness to try new things.</span></p></li><li><p><span>Ability to work effectively under limited supervision. </span></p></li><li><p><span>Excel and Tableau Skills are a plus.</span><span> </span></p></li></ul><p></p><p></p>The base pay range represents the anticipated low and high end of the pay range for this position. <p style="text-align:left">You‚Äôve invested a lot of time and energy in your education. Now you want the chance to make your mark. We offer challenging opportunities for you to learn and grow professionally. In our programs, you‚Äôll be immersed in a culture of continuous improvement, with the goal of changing health care for the better.</p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p><b>Position Summary:</b></p><p>At CVS Health, we are focused on transforming health care for our customers and making our company a great place to work. We help people navigate the health care system ‚Äì and their personal health care ‚Äì by improving access, lowering costs and being a trusted partner for every meaningful moment of health. Within our Retail locations, we bring this promise to life with heart every day. Our 3rd year Pharmacy Interns play a critical role in supporting our pharmacy teams to consistently deliver on our brand promise, while developing their own skills in preparation for increasing responsibility.</p><p></p><p>As a 3rd year Pharmacy Intern, you will be focused on applying didactic learning from pharmacy school into real-world practice to become ready for a Pharmacist role. Under the direction of your preceptor, you will complete a comprehensive training roadmap designed to show you first-hand what it‚Äôs like to be part of a pharmacy team while gaining an overview of store, district, and regional operations. You will gain valuable hands-on experience through a training roadmap that includes a combination of Key Learning Experiences (KLEs), activities, and time spent with leaders in your district. While in the pharmacy, you will assist the pharmacy team to ensure that pharmacy operations run smoothly, our patients‚Äô prescriptions are filled promptly, safely, and accurately, and we are providing caring service that exceeds patient expectations. You will learn to operate as part of the pharmacy team through consistent application of Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), best practices, and effective communication. Throughout your shifts and in all customer and colleague interactions, you will learn to demonstrate empathy and genuine care, and contribute to a safe and inclusive culture where all people feel valued and empowered.</p><p></p><p>3rd year Pharmacy Interns are responsible for completion of a comprehensive training roadmap, focusing on KLEs that build aptitude in the following areas. As tenure increases, 3rd year Pharmacy Interns take on increasing responsibility of the safety and effectiveness of operations in the pharmacy, including but not limited to: </p><p></p><ul><li>Living our purpose by following all company SOPs at each workstation to help our Pharmacists and Technicians manage and improve patient health</li><li>Following pharmacy workflow procedures at each pharmacy workstation (i.e., production, pick-up, drive-thru, and drop-off) for safe and accurate prescription fulfillment</li><li>Contributing to positive patient experiences showing empathy and genuine care: creating heartfelt and personalized moments while serving patients at pick-up, drive-thru, and over the phone; keeping patients healthy by offering immunizations and other services at the register and over the phone; and demonstrating compassionate care by solving or escalating patient problems</li><li>Offering to counsel, fielding medical questions, and soliciting information on a patient‚Äôs medical history to provide optimal care, when appropriate under the direct supervision of a licensed pharmacist</li><li>Taking telephonic prescriptions from the prescriber, and calling the prescriber to clarify prescriptions or facilitate medication changes, where allowed by state regulation</li><li>Maintaining the highest level of self-awareness and providing in-the-moment coaching, training, and mentoring to pharmacy team members while sharing best practices</li><li>Completing basic inventory activities, as permitted by law, and as directed by the pharmacy leadership team, such as accurately putting away medication deliveries and completing cycle counts, returns-to-stocks, waiting bin inventories, etc.</li><li>Contributing to a high-performing team, embracing a growth mindset, and being receptive to feedback; actively seeking opportunities to expand clinical and technical knowledge needed to better assist patients</li><li>Remaining flexible for both scheduling and business needs, while contributing to a safe, inclusive, and engaging team dynamic; voluntarily traveling to stores in the market to work shifts as needed by the business</li><li>Understanding and complying with all relevant federal, state, and local laws, regulations, professional standards, and ethical principles. Complying with CVS policies and procedures to ensure patient safety, compliance with controlled substance dispensing and recordkeeping, and to protect patient privacy and security</li><li>Delivering additional patient health care services (e.g., immunizations, point-of-care testing, and voluntarily staffing offsite clinics), where allowable by law and supported by required training and certification</li></ul><p></p><p>Where permissible, the 3rd year Pharmacy Intern may also support immunizations, which includes the following responsibilities:</p><ul><li>Completing additional licensure and training requirements, in compliance with state Board of Pharmacy regulations, to obtain Technician Immunizer status to support preparing and administering vaccines</li><li>Educating patients about the importance of vaccines and referring patients to the Pharmacist-on-duty for vaccination questions</li><li>Monitoring for, and responding to, adverse reactions; reporting adverse reaction events per public health requirements</li><li>Reviewing and collecting patient information; tracking and documenting for each applicable patient</li></ul><p></p><p><b>Required Qualifications:</b></p><ul><li>Accepted into, or actively enrolled in, an ACPE accredited college or school of pharmacy</li><li>Must possess, or be in the process of obtaining, valid intern and/or technician licensure as required</li></ul><p></p><p><b>Essential Functions:</b></p><ul><li>Regular and predictable attendance, including nights and weekends</li><li>Ability to complete required training within designated timeframe</li><li>Attention and Focus:<ul><li>Ability to concentrate on a task over a period of time</li><li>Ability to pivot quickly from one task to another to meet verbal and written communication to interact with patients and colleagues</li><li>Utilize active listening by giving full attention to what others are saying, taking time to understand the points the total number of tablets to dispense, day‚Äôs supply, and/or number of full bottles and additional bottles needed to fill a prescription</li></ul></li><li>Problem Resolution:<ul><li>Identifying challenging patient or colleague interactions and choosing the best course of action when faced multiple options</li></ul></li><li>Physical Demands:<ul><li>Be mobile and remain upright for extended periods of time</li><li>Lift, scan, and bag items</li><li>Reach overhead; stretch or reach out with the body, arms, and/or legs to grasp items</li><li>Move fingers repetitively; picking, pinching, adjust machines to exact positions</li><li>Stoop to a considerable degree, requiring full use of the lower extremities and back muscles to move items between low and high positions, including bending our pharmacies or through our health service offerings, we are pioneering a bold new approach to total health care. We await your fresh ideas, new perspectives, and the unique contributions you will make to our organization.</p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p>We anticipate the application window for this opening will close on: 03/31/2026<p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:inherit"></p><p style="text-align:left">Qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with all federal, state and local laws.</p>

<p>Ready to shape the future of food?</p> <p>Join Butterball, America's favorite turkey brand, for an exciting summer internship! Butterball, LLC, is one of America's most iconic brands and the most loved and trusted brand of turkey in the United States. Known for helping consumers celebrate Thanksgiving, Butterball also brings delicious turkey products to tables around the world every day. Located in the thriving Raleigh-Durham, North Carolina area, our business model gives us the opportunity to provide a diverse array of career opportunities and paths which include live operations, processing facilities, corporate functions, and support offices. At Butterball, we aim to provide great-tasting foods that bring people together and inspire meaningful moments with the people who matter most.</p> <p>Over the course of 10-12 weeks, as an IT Site Admin Intern, you'll work in Carthage, MO or Huntsville, AR. This internship's goal will be to identify a technology-based improvement opportunity and devise and manage the project plan for implementation. This could entail a brand-new project or building from an existing project. The program's primary objective is to grow future leaders by providing professional development, and a series of assignments that aligns with professional interest within the processing and manufacturing industry.</p> <p>What you'll do:</p> <ul> <li>On-site process evaluation with operations groups to identify a need for technology-based improvement.</li> <li>Collaborate with internal and external teams to identify the best possible solution to said challenge.</li> <li>Submit a project proposal, build, and manage the project using our project management tool, Smartsheet.</li> <li>Projects may range from digitizing current paper processes, creating SOP documents, calculating ROI for current or potential opportunities, implementing new or current software to create more efficient processes for our operations teams, as well as other projects not yet discovered. </li> <li>Collaborate with multiple departments throughout Butterball, including CI, Manufacturing, Maintenance, Engineering, Live Operations, IT, and corporate support groups.</li> </ul> <p>What you'll get:</p> <ul> <li>Hands-on experience and professional development.</li> <li>Opportunities to network and learn from industry experts.</li> <li>Competitive compensation and benefits.</li> </ul> <p>We're looking for awesome students like you! </p> <p>Do you have a knack for problem-solving and a passion for food? We're looking for creative minds who can help us make our food production process even better. You'll need to be a team player, ready to roll up your sleeves and get things done. Think you have what it takes to make a delicious difference?</p> <p>Additional eligibility requirements: ?</p> <ul> <li>Pursuing a Bachelors in Information Technology, Data Analytics, Business, Engineering or related field with an expected graduation date of December 2026 through June 2027.</li> <li>All participants in this program are required to have a valid drivers license and reliable transportation to and from work.</li> <li>There will be frequent travel to our plants and live operation locations depending on project needs.</li> <li>The individual in this role will be required to initiate, lead, and follow through on conversations, presentations, and training, and should be comfortable with public speaking.</li> <li>This role requires a balance of technical, analytical thinking as well as being personable and able to make connections to further implement change on an enterprise level.</li> <li>Strong business acumen - ability to understand the impact of IT on different parts of the business.</li> </ul>

Description:By bringing together people that use their passion for purposeful innovation, at Lockheed Martin we keep people safe and solve the world's most complex challenges. Our people are some of the greatest minds in the industry and truly make Lockheed Martin a great place to work. Your Mission is Ours.

Upon joining our team you will be part of a culture that inspires employees to envision the impossible, perform with excellence, and build incredible products that provide critical national capabilities. One day the world may hear the full story of your achievements and discover the critical role you‚Äôve contributed to defend America.

As a Launch System Integrator - Intern, you will provide technical support and direction while working with teams on cross-level multidisciplinary product development teams. You will support core systems engineering activities, verification activities, and serve as a liaison between government customers and launch vehicle contractors. This role also provides responsibility for coordinating integrated ground operations, rehearsal planning, and flight operations support. The internship offers hands on exposure to end to end launch operations and the opportunity to work alongside engineers on high impact missions.

‚Ä¢ Support the development of Launch Vehicle Requirements and review verification.
Conduct trade studies, risk assessments, and configuration management.
‚Ä¢ Coordinate verification activities across internal teams and external partners.
‚Ä¢ Support all working group meetings, technical exchange meetings and readiness reviews.
‚Ä¢ Provide integration, coordination, and technical support to integrate a Satellite Vehicle onto a Launch Vehicle system which includes LV/SV interfaces, environments, launch facilities, communications and transportation
‚Ä¢ Interface with flight operations SMEs to coordinate insertion orbits and compliance to requirements. Serve as a point of contact for day to day communications with government customers and launch vehicle contractors (e.g., SpaceX, ULA).
‚Ä¢ Attend and contribute to various Working Groups and other stakeholder meetings.
‚Ä¢ Coordinate electrical compatibility reviews, ensuring power, grounding, and data interface requirements are met.
‚Ä¢ Work with electrical engineering teams to resolve interface mismatches .
Basic Qualifications:
‚Ä¢ Student pursuing Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Aerospace Engineering or related field from an accredited college, or equivalent experience/combined education.
‚Ä¢ Ability to travel 20% of the time, including extended travel.
‚Ä¢ Strong interpersonal skills and a demonstrated ability to develop and maintain strong internal and external customer relationships.
‚Ä¢ Ability to obtain a TS/SCI clearance.
Desired Skills:
‚Ä¢ Experience supporting execution of test events, evaluation of results, and development of verification reports to ensure requirement compliance.
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated experience in performing technical studies and system trades for enhanced capabilities.
‚Ä¢ Ability to coordinate with and interface with numerous customers, be proficient at delivering technical briefings.
‚Ä¢ Current Top Secret/SCI security clearance
Security Clearance Statement: This position requires a government security clearance, you must be a US Citizen for consideration.
Clearance Level: TS/SCI w/Poly

job_title: Disney Entertainment Software Engineering Intern, Summer 2026
job_description:
About the Role & Program:

Do you remember seeing ads for Lilo and Stitch earlier last summer? What about Tron: Ares or Predator: Badlands in the Fall? If you did, it was likely because of the detailed planning and execution of the Disney Entertainment Media and Marketing team‚Ä¶and if you didn‚Äôt ‚Äì it‚Äôs probably because our targeting is that good.

We are looking for a Software Engineering Intern to join the Performance Marketing arm of this media team in Summer 2026. We are an integrated, cross-functional team of marketers, software engineers, data scientists, and analysts who help the Media team execute highly data-driven marketing campaigns for theatrical, streaming, and brand campaigns.

As a Software Engineering Intern, you will contribute to our growing technology portfolio: innovative campaign planning tools, complex data science workflows, and elegant web applications that blend the art of advertising at Disney with the science of our data-backed insights.

This role is unique ‚Äì our team is embedded directly within the Disney marketing organization. We're aligned and mission-driven, with the freedom to move fast and innovate to achieve our goals. You'll tackle the challenges of executing a precise paid media strategy, using the latest technologies and tools in the data/tech space. If you're excited about this, please get in touch ‚Äì we'd love to hear from you!

What You Will Do:

  • Write code, fix bugs, and contribute to the development of a suite of tools used by the Performance Marketing group to execute on theatrical, streaming, and brand campaigns
  • Build and expand on backend services that automate and facilitate the execution of data-driven media campaigns on third party ad platforms
  • Collaborate with the broader team of media/marketing experts to rapidly iterate from prototypes to high-quality, production pipelines
  • Implement quality controls, monitoring, and other safeguards to ensure optimizations are accurately and safely applied to in-flight ad campaigns and key business metrics are always presented accurately

Required Qualifications & Skills:

  • Experience with building applications or services using Python, Java, or similar
  • Demonstrated ability to build any technical component in a larger system (e.g. microservice, API endpoint) as well as a deep understanding of the overall system architecture
  • Exceptional hands-on experience and strong core engineering skills ‚Äî whether through internships, personal projects, or academic work
  • Familiarity with version control systems (e.g. Git, GitHub/GitLab) and standard software development lifecycle tools (e.g. CI/CD pipelines)

Preferred Qualifications & Skills:

  • Experience with Spark or SQL
  • Understanding of cloud compute (AWS, GCM, etc) and modern dev ops practices; understanding of CI/CD automation
  • Knowledge of ad platforms including DMPs, Google Ads, Facebook/Instagram, Innovid, LiveRamp and DSPs (Google DV360, Trade Desk, Verizon Media Group)

Education:

  • Junior or Senior year preferred
  • Major or significant coursework in Computer Science, Information Systems, Software, Electrical or Electronics Engineering, or comparable field of study

Eligibility Requirements & Program Information:

  • Be enrolled in an accredited college/university pursuing a degree taking at least one class in the semester/quarter (spring/fall) prior to participation in the internship program AND returning to school the semester/quarter following the internship OR currently participating in a Disney College Program or Disney Internship.
  • Current Disney Interns, College, International, or Culinary Program Participants: You may only work for ONE consecutive year (12 months) in any combination of an internship and/or program.
  • Be at least 18 years of age
  • Possess unrestricted work authorization


The pay rate for this role in Burbank is $42.00 per hour. Select benefits may be provided as part of the compensation package, such as medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the level and position offered. To learn more about our benefits visit: https://jobs.disneycareers.com/benefits.

Want to accelerate your career? Join a team of driven people, performing with purpose.

At Avis Budget Group, we are proud to be a performance driven organization. Our 21,000+ employees encourage each other to be at their best through outstanding leadership, training and tools and rewards.

As a participant of our ABG Accelerate internship program you will be encouraged to explore different areas of our business to grow both personally and professionally to jump start a rewarding career.

The 10 Week Accelerate Internship Program consists of:

  • Learning the ins and outs of your department
  • Professional development workshops
  • Hear from our leaders to learn more about our business
  • Network with our senior leadership team
  • Visit our field operations to learn how your team influences our daily operations

What you'll do

  • Build new applications/tools/systems system for business critical operations

  • Engage with users to iteratively refine solutions, quickly test ideas, and build upon feedback

What we‚Äôre looking for:

  • Expected Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in an engineering field such as Computer Science, Data Science, Operations Research, Physics

  • Programming experience with languages such as Python, Java, TypeScript/JavaScript and a strong understanding of object oriented programming concepts

  • Experience building applications to efficiently collect, manage, and process large data sets for analytics, ensuring fast performance and user-friendly interfaces

  • Comfortable in a fast-paced, high-demand environment with ever-evolving objectives

  • Strong collaboration skills, working effectively with both technical and non-technical teams.

  • Experience in a customer-facing environment, with proven ability to engage and collaborate with stakeholders outside of your immediate team

  • Experience years of experience with RESTful Web services (preferred)

  • Experience with progressive and responsive web design (preferred)

  • Knowledge of SQL and hands-on experience with MySQL databases (preferred)

The hourly rate for this position is $30 an hour.

Who we are:

Here at Avis Budget Group, you will be joining a team of 25,000 driven people, performing with purpose. Together, we‚Äôre moving the future of transportation forward with our innovative, customer-focused solutions.

Our culture is performance driven, where we encourage and support each other to be at our best through leadership, training, tools, and rewards.

We are proud to make a positive difference to the lives of our colleagues, customers, and communities where we operate.

Avis Budget Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer ‚Äì Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran or any other category protected by applicable law.

This advertisement does not constitute a promise or guarantee of employment. This advertisement describes the general nature and level of this position only. Essential functions and responsibilities may change as business needs require. The compensation and benefits information is accurate as of the date of this posting. The Company reserves the right to modify this information at any time, with or without notice, subject to applicable law. This position may be with any affiliate of Avis Budget Group.
